title.narrative: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO - High Priority Reopening and Maintenance Project

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to re-establish lasting road access between provincial capitals, districts and territories, in the Project impact area in a manner that is sustainable for the natural environment

participating-org.narrative: Multi Donor Trust Fund for High-Priority Roads Reopening and Maintenance Project in the Democratic Republic of Congo(DRC-Pro Routes)

title.narrative: Reopened project roads in good to fair condition
Days per year with roads not passable by 4x2 vehicles on reopened sections
Sound road transport strategy and road investment plan completed
Size of the total classified network
Roads in good and fair condition as a share of total classified roads
number of people connected to all season roads
Percentage of illegal timbers in the monthly volume of handicraft timber checked at selected control points along:
Percentage of protected species in the monthly count of bush meat checked at selected control points along:
Number of MECNT and ICCN staff trained and active in implementing laws and accompanying local initiatives
Kilometers of project roads maintained each year
Sexually active people reporting use of condom during their last intercourse in selected communities
Percentage of annual national road maintenance budget disbursed
Share of rural population with access to an all-season road
Number of rural people with access to an all-season road
Action plan to develop the road construction industry implemented
Percentage of project beneficiaries consulted during the project implementation period
Deforestation rate within a bandwith of 10 kilometers centered on the project's road sections.
